properties.areaDesc: Pulaski, VA; City of Radford, VA; Montgomery, VA
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 7 at 11:06AM EST until February 8 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service Blacksburg Va has issued
a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia...

New River At Radford affecting City of Radford...Montgomery and
Pulaski Counties

Several inches of rain fell across the New River Basin on
Thursday. Excessive runoff continues upstream forcing the
New River as well as its tributaries into flood. The New River is
now expected to exceed minor flood stage at Radford and continue
rising to just below 15.0 feet later today. Necessary precautions
need to be taken.

The National Weather Service in Blacksburg Va has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the New River At Radford.
* through Saturday morning.
* At 10 AM EST Friday the stage was 14.0 feet...and rising.
* Flood Stage is 14.0 feet. Moderate flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to
continue.
* Forecast...Continue to rise to near 14.7 feet later this
afternoon. The river is forecast to fall below flood stage
early Saturday.
* Impact...at 14.0 feet...Riverside parking lots are affected
* Flood history...this crest compares to a previous crest of 14.4
feet on Mar 7 2011.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive through flooded areas...the water may be much deeper
than you think.

Listen to noaa weather radio or your favorite media outlet for later
statements or warnings.
